original: / las med pa ni nye bar len pa mi 'byung ste /

analyzed: sdug bsngal yang 'dir rnam pa gsum du bshad do //

translated: Therefore, having understood that all of this is based on craving, one should strive to abandon it. This is stated in order to teach that.

original: sred pa spangs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sred pa spangs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

analyzed: 'dir ni spang dka'i sred pa ste //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: sred pa de spongs la zhes bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa ste /

analyzed: rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnyen pos zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //

original: dang gi sgra ni khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni khyad par gyi don to //

original: gang sred pa dang 'grogs pa ni 'khor ba yin gyi gang de spangs pa dang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang sred pa dang 'grogs pa ni 'khor ba yin gyi gang de spangs pa dang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: that which is accompanied by craving is sa·πÉsƒÅra, but that which is free from craving is not.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni bstan pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni bstan pa 'di la'o //

original: yang na 'jig rten gyi yid du 'ong ba'i yul la'o //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gyi yid du 'ong ba'i yul la'o //

original: ci zhig byas nas sred pa spang bar brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas sred pa spang bar brjod par bya zhe na /

analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol pa rnams kyi ni de spangs pa de yang rtsa ba'i rgyun las gcod par mi nus pa yin te /

analyzed: sred pa la gnas pas spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //

original: spang dka' zhes bya ba ni bsal bar dka' ba ste /
analyzed: spang dka' zhes bya ba ni bsal bar dka' ba ste /

analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam nyid kyi spang ba yin te /

original: de ni yang du 'khor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni yang du 'khor mi 'gyur //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i sa bon bcad pa'i 'phags pa'i nyan thos de ni yang 'khor bar mi 'khor ro zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol pa de dag gis ni sa bon ma bcad pa'i phyir 'khor bar 'gyur la /

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes bstan pa /

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid la ni thams cad kyi thams cad du sred pa med la phyi rol pa rnams @116b la ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir de ni yang skye ba yin te /

original: byi ba'i dug rnam par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byi ba'i dug rnam par gyur pa bzhin no //

analyzed: sred pa thams cad spong bar rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis smos so //
translated: The second half of the verse is quoted in the BodhicaryƒÅvatƒÅra:

analyzed: thams cad la phyin ci ma log pa'i rjes su bstan pa sbyin par ni dge slong mood gal gyi bu chen pos kyang mi nus na gzhan gyis lta smos kyang ci dgos //
translated: ‚ÄúEven the great MaudgalyƒÅyana cannot teach all the dharmas without error, much less anyone else.‚ÄùüîΩThe Arthavini≈õcayas≈´tra says:

analyzed: re ba ta ka zhes bya ba de'i nye gnas la ji ltar yang de'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan nas 'di gsungs so //

original: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni gang bcings pa dang / gang gis dang de la ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba dang de sgrub pa'i dus kyang mi rtag pa nyid kyis de'i dus 'das pa nyid na sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba drag po dang ldan pa nyid du bstan to //

analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni yul la sred pa dang lus la sred pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: nas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi kha skong ba'am yang na 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi kha skong ba'am yang na 'byed pa yin no //

original: gang gis 'ching ba ni gzhan yang 'ching ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gang gis 'ching ba ni gzhan yang 'ching ba yin mod kyi /

original: srid pa gtsor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa gtsor bstan pa ste /

original: bcings pa de nyid do //
analyzed: bcings pa de nyid do //

analyzed: de la lha rnams ni 'dod pas yongs su tshol bar bya ba med de /

original: de nas bcings nas 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas bcings nas 'jog pa yin no //

original: don du gnyer ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni don du gnyer ba'o //

original: 'dir bag med par ma byed cig pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir bag med par ma byed cig pa ste /

original: ngal ba las 'das par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: ngal ba las 'das par ma byed cig pa'o //

analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa mi bya ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

original: dal 'byor chud ni mi gsan par //
analyzed: dal 'byor chud ni mi gsan par //
translated: Do not let the opportunity for liberation be lost.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says this because

original: mi ni mi khom pa brgyad spangs pa'i dal ba ste /
analyzed: mi ni mi khom pa brgyad spangs pa'i dal ba ste /

original: de khyod kyis chung ma gsan cig pa ni thob nas 'das pa dang don med pas 'da' bar ma byed cig pa'i don to //
analyzed: de khyod kyis chung ma gsan cig pa ni thob nas 'das pa dang don med pas 'da' bar ma byed cig pa'i don to //
translated: Having obtained it, do not let it be lost, because it is meaningless.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar sbyar ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar sbyar ba yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it connected in this way?üîΩHe says:

original: smras pa / dal 'byor thal bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / dal 'byor thal bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The opportunity is lost through negligence.

original: dal ba ni ji skad du bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: dal ba ni ji skad du bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The opportunity is as it has been taught.

original: thal ba ni dal ba las 'das pa ste dal ba nyams pa'o //
analyzed: thal ba ni dal ba las 'das pa ste dal ba nyams pa'o //
translated: Negligence is passing beyond the opportunity, the loss of the opportunity.

original: bas zhes bya ba ni rgyu bstan pa'i don te /
analyzed: bas zhes bya ba ni rgyu bstan pa'i don te /
translated: Through means that the cause is taught.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar dal 'byor la gnas nas bag med pas sred pa'i dbang du ci dgar spyod pa de ni dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar dal 'byor la gnas nas bag med pas sred pa'i dbang du ci dgar spyod pa de ni dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Because in this way, those who are endowed with leisure and opportunity but who are heedless and who indulge their desires as they please will be born in the hells.

original: bag med pa dang sred pa de gnyis kyis 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur na ni 'gyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bag med pa dang sred pa de gnyis kyis 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur na ni 'gyod par 'gyur te /
translated: When the results of heedlessness and craving are manifest, they will feel remorse.

original: srid pa'i dbang gis sngon bag med pa byas pa ni bdag gis legs par ma byas so zhes so //
analyzed: srid pa'i dbang gis sngon bag med pa byas pa ni bdag gis legs par ma byas so zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúI have not done well, in that through craving I have been heedless in the past.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir sngon bdag gis byas pa ma dran par gyur pa de'i tshe na yang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i reg pa drag pos mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don par 'gyur te /

analyzed: sred pa las 'da' bar ma byas na sdug bsngal thams cad 'byung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa //

analyzed: gang phyir sred pa'i mtsho zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;

original: yang du ste /

original: mi 'jug pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: mi 'jug pa nyid du'o //

analyzed: bcad kyang ljon shing zhes bya ba ni sta re la sogs pas shing dum bu gnyis su byas kyang phyir zhing skye ba kho nar zad ces bya ba yin te /

original: yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It grows again.

analyzed: dpe bstan pas dpes mtshon pa'i don bshad pa'i phyir @118b smras pa /

analyzed: mi ldog ces bya ba ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i phung po'i bdag nyid skye bar 'gyur ba'o //

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni nang ngo //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni nang ngo //

original: yang dang yang du zhes bya ba ni phyir zhing phyir zhing ste /
analyzed: yang dang yang du zhes bya ba ni phyir zhing phyir zhing ste /
translated: It is said again and again because it is repeatedly, again and again.

analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas sred pa des yang dang yang du sdug bsngal ba'i phung po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

translated: This is said in order to introduce the cultivation of the supramundane path by showing the power of the mundane path.üîΩIn order to establish that one should definitely avoid that craving, since it is the cause of suffering, he says:

original: dper na bdag nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos so //
analyzed: dper na bdag nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos so //
translated: For example, like a fire that is well enflamed, one should avoid craving, which is the cause of suffering.

original: mgar ba zhig mtshon byas pa rnams 'tshong zhing 'tsho bar byed pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: mgar ba zhig mtshon byas pa rnams 'tshong zhing 'tsho bar byed pa zhig yod de /
translated: A blacksmith, who made and sold weapons for a living,

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na bdag nyid kyis byas pa'i ral gyi mchan khung du bcug ste /
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na bdag nyid kyis byas pa'i ral gyi mchan khung du bcug ste /
translated: at one time put a sword that he had made into the crook of his arm

original: bya ba zhig gi phyir grong bar du chas so //
analyzed: bya ba zhig gi phyir grong bar du chas so //
translated: and went to the village for some business.

original: de lam de na rkun po sdig pa can dag gnas te /
analyzed: de lam de na rkun po sdig pa can dag gnas te /
translated: On the road, some wicked thieves were staying there.

original: des de mtshon de nyid kyis bsad nas rdzas khyer te song ba las de'i dbang du mdzad de 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: des de mtshon de nyid kyis bsad nas rdzas khyer te song ba las de'i dbang du mdzad de 'di gsungs so //
translated: He killed him with that very sword, took his possessions, and left.

original: sred pa bdag nyid las skyes pa ste /

analyzed: bag med pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi phan pa nyams pa ste /

original: tha mal pa'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa'o //

analyzed: yang na rnam pa bzhi ste /

translated: ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata has compassion for one person. Venerable One, what is the cause? What is the condition?‚Äù

translated: The village chief, that is not the case. As long as there are three fields for a farmer householder:

analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab la gzud pa yin no //

analyzed: gsum pas ni dka' ba spyod pa las bzlog pa yin te /

analyzed: gang gi dka' thub kyis bdag nyid yongs su gdung bar byed cing 'dis yongs su dag par blta ba'o //

original: bzhis pas ni de bsten pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: bzhis pas ni de bsten pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //

analyzed: lta ba ngan pa'i lta ba de la 'dod pa med pa ste //

analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa la 'jug pa'i lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /

analyzed: gang so so'i skye bo'i dge ba gang mthong ba'i dbang gis las dang / 'bras bu yod pa nyid las brtsams te /

analyzed: bzod thob ngan song gsum du mi ltung ngo //

original: zhes pa'i lung gis so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i lung gis so //

analyzed: bslab ces bya ba ni brtson pas bya ba ste /

original: mya ngan med pa yin zhes bya ba ni yid kyi gdung ba de la mi skye ba nyid de /
analyzed: mya ngan med pa yin zhes bya ba ni yid kyi gdung ba de la mi skye ba nyid de /

analyzed: 'di la nyon mongs pa'i skyon med pa dang / nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //

original: kha cig na re log par shes pa las bag med pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re log par shes pa las bag med pa 'byung ste /

analyzed: gcer bu pa dag thar pa 'dod pa'i phyir shin tu dka' ba'i dka' thub la sogs pa spyod pa yin no//

original: mkhas pas bag dang ldan par bya //
analyzed: mkhas pas bag dang ldan par bya //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bag med pa de mkhas pas bsrung bar bya ba'o //

original: dang gi sgra ni khyad par te /

original: 'di ni bag yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bag yod pa'o //

analyzed: mkhas pa gang la yod pa de ni blo dang ldan pa ste /

analyzed: phyin ci ma log par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: ji lta bur bag yod pa 'di ni bsrungs pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: smras pa / tshong dpon ltar zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: des na yang de nyid la gzud pa'i phyir / bag med pa la mi sbyor zhing //

analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: par byed pa'i chos la yang dag par sbyor ba yin no //

original: bag med pa la mi sbyor zhing //
analyzed: bag med pa la mi sbyor zhing //

original: 'dir yang mi sbyor zhing zhes bya ba rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yang mi sbyor zhing zhes bya ba rjes su 'brang ngo //

analyzed: 'dod pa la dga' bas byas pa'i mtshungs par ldan pas gnas pa las bzlog pa'o //

analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la byung bar gyur kyang zag pa zad pa las ring du gnas pa yin te /

analyzed: gang de thob pa la 'gal ba'i chos bsten pa des na de nyid kyi phyir gnyis po de las ldog pa yin no //

original: ji ltar zhe na /

original: 'di ltar bag yod ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bag yod ces bya ba smos te /

analyzed: rtag tu sems byed pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bsgom pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pa ste /

analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi tshul gyis rgyun mi 'chad par bsgom pa la 'jug cing mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel bar byed pa yin te ;

analyzed: gang 'dod pa la dga' ba la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdoes not engage‚Äù is that one does not engage in the delight of desire, etc.

original: thob par gyur pa ni phyin par 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: thob par gyur pa ni phyin par 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving attained‚Äù means having reached.

original: zag pa zad pa ni nyon mongs pa zad pa ste dgra bcom pa nyid do //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa ni nyon mongs pa zad pa ste dgra bcom pa nyid do //
translated: The ‚Äúdestruction of the contaminants‚Äù is the destruction of the afflictions, which is the state of arhatship.

original: de thob par gyur na ni zag pa gsum zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thob par gyur na ni zag pa gsum zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one attains that, the three contaminants are destroyed.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni thar pa 'dod pa la le lo che ba dang / yul la mngon par dga' ba rnams la de'i gnyen po la gzud pa'i phyir gsungs so //

original: yang gi sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The word even though has the meaning of ‚Äúbecause. ‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir sdug pa spangs shing med par gyur na mya ngan la sogs pa de dag med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sdug pa spangs shing med par gyur na mya ngan la sogs pa de dag med par 'gyur te /
translated: Because when the beloved is abandoned and becomes nonexistent, those such as sorrow become nonexistent.

original: de dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not occur.

original: 'di gnyis ni rgyu dang rgyu can gyi mtshan nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni rgyu dang rgyu can gyi mtshan nyid du brjod do //
translated: These two are described as having the nature of cause and effect.

original: gang rgyu yod na ni 'byung la gang med na ni mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang rgyu yod na ni 'byung la gang med na ni mi 'byung ste /
translated: When the cause exists, it occurs; when the cause does not exist, it does not occur.

original: de yang dper na sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang dper na sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no //
translated: That is, for example, like a seed and a sprout.

original: mya ngan med pa'i bde ba'i khyad par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan med pa'i bde ba'i khyad par 'dod pa ste /
translated: The difference between the sorrowless and the happy is desired.

original: bram ze de sdug pa yongs su spang ba la gzud pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: bram ze de sdug pa yongs su spang ba la gzud pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The brahmin said this in order to introduce the abandonment of the beloved.

original: gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response, the Blessed One said, ‚ÄúBecause of what?‚Äù and so on.

original: gang yin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyid kyi don te /
analyzed: gang yin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyid kyi don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúwhat‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúwhat is.‚Äù

original: bde ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: bde ba nyid yin no //
translated: It is happiness itself.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni 'dod chags dang bral bi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni 'dod chags dang bral bi rnam pa ste /
translated: Thus, those who are free from attachment are of this type.

original: khams gang na yang cung zad sdug pa med de khams gsum gyi 'dod chags spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gang na yang cung zad sdug pa med de khams gsum gyi 'dod chags spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no beloved whatsoever in any realm, because they have abandoned attachment to the three realms.

original: de bas gdung med ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar bde ba yang dag par skyes pa de bas na de la mngon par phyogs shing bde ba thob par 'dod pas ni 'ga' la yang sdug pa skyes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bas gdung med ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar bde ba yang dag par skyes pa de bas na de la mngon par phyogs shing bde ba thob par 'dod pas ni 'ga' la yang sdug pa skyes par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the one called ‚Äúfree of grief‚Äù is because, since one has thus generated happiness, one who is inclined toward that and who desires to attain happiness should not generate any grief toward anyone.

original: gdung ba thams cad dang sred par byed pa thams cad ni de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdung ba thams cad dang sred par byed pa thams cad ni de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all grief and all craving are connected with that.

original: gdung med ces bya ba ni gang la mya ngan med pa thob pa de nyid de /
analyzed: gdung med ces bya ba ni gang la mya ngan med pa thob pa de nyid de /
translated: The one called ‚Äúfree of grief‚Äù is the one who has attained the absence of grief.

original: gdung ba thams cad bsal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gdung ba thams cad bsal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all grief is removed.

original: rdul bral zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ste 'dir 'dod chags nyid rdul yin gyi /
analyzed: rdul bral zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ste 'dir 'dod chags nyid rdul yin gyi /
translated: The one called ‚Äúfree of dust‚Äù is the one who is free of afflictions. Here, attachment itself is dust,

original: sa'i rdul ni ma yin no zhes pa'i lung gi so //
analyzed: sa'i rdul ni ma yin no zhes pa'i lung gi so //
translated: not the dust of the earth.

original: go 'phang zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /üîΩde nyid na @143a * //
analyzed: go 'phang zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste / de nyid na @143a * //
translated: The state is nirvana.üîΩThat itself is the state of the one who is free of dust.

original: sdug bsngal de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no suffering and no cause of suffering there.

original: don gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni kun du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: don gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni kun du 'dod pa'o //
translated: The one who desires the meaning is the one who is desirous.

original: yang na thob par 'dod pa ste sgrub pa ste sgrub par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na thob par 'dod pa ste sgrub pa ste sgrub par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Or, he should desire to attain, i.e., to accomplish, the state of a Buddha.

original: sdug par bya de mi bya //
analyzed: sdug par bya de mi bya //
translated: He should not do what is pleasing to him.

original: zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i dngos po yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i dngos po yongs su gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: This means that he should not grasp at the things that he is attached to.

original: nam yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis kyang ste /
analyzed: nam yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis kyang ste /
translated: Never means by any means.

original: nang dang phyi rol des mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol des mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The inner and outer are the levels of concentration and post-concentration, etc.

original: sdug pa dang phrad par 'dod pa bram ze de'i dga' ba dang bcas pa'i blo des par byas pa las bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sdug pa dang phrad par 'dod pa bram ze de'i dga' ba dang bcas pa'i blo des par byas pa las bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: The desire to meet with the pleasant is the delight of the Brahman. In order to reverse that, he says:

original: sdug pa ma mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sdug pa ma mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He should not see the pleasant, etc.

original: nam yang 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i yul la phrad par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: nam yang 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i yul la phrad par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Never should he meet with an object that is completely entangled with passion.

original: nam yang zhes bya ba ni nam zhig kyang ngo //
analyzed: nam yang zhes bya ba ni nam zhig kyang ngo //
translated: Never means at any time.

original: gdol ba la sogs pa'i sdug pa dang phrad pa yang phung khrol chen por bskyed na /
analyzed: gdol ba la sogs pa'i sdug pa dang phrad pa yang phung khrol chen por bskyed na /
translated: If meeting with the pleasant of an outcaste, etc. generates great misfortune,üîΩwhat need is there to mention the misfortune that comes from meeting with the pleasant of a god?

original: bram ze la sogs pa'i lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa'i lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: what need be said of Brahmins and so on?

original: ci sdug pa dang phrad pa bzhin du mi sdug pa dang phrad pa yang 'gag gam ma yin zhe na /üîΩmi sdug mthong na'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ci sdug pa dang phrad pa bzhin du mi sdug pa dang phrad pa yang 'gag gam ma yin zhe na / mi sdug mthong na'ang de bzhin no //
translated: Is it that, just as one meets with what is pleasant, so one also meets with what is unpleasant?üîΩOne should not meet with what is unpleasant,

original: mi 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams dang yang nam yang phrad par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams dang yang nam yang phrad par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: and one should not meet with what is pleasant.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni khyad par du sdug pa dang phrad pa dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni khyad par du sdug pa dang phrad pa dgag pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse is meant to deny the meeting with what is pleasant in particular.üîΩWhy is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because:üîΩOne suffers from not seeing what is pleasant.

original: 'di ltar / sdug pa ma mthong sdug bsngal la //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di ltar / sdug pa ma mthong sdug bsngal la // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: One suffers from not seeing what is pleasant.

original: bral ba la sogs pas sdug pa mthong na ni gdung ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bral ba la sogs pas sdug pa mthong na ni gdung ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one does not see what is pleasant, one suffers from separation and so on.

original: mi sdug dang yang phrad mi bya //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi sdug dang yang phrad mi bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not meet with what is unpleasant.

original: yang gi sgras ni sdug bsngal rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni sdug bsngal rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse is meant to deny the meeting with what is unpleasant.üîΩOne should not meet with what is unpleasant.üîΩWhen one meets with what is unpleasant, one suffers from the meeting itself.

original: sngon ma mthong ba'i dngos po dang phrad na yang rgyun du sdug bsngal mang po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sngon ma mthong ba'i dngos po dang phrad na yang rgyun du sdug bsngal mang po 'byung ngo //
translated: When one meets with something that one has never seen before, one suffers from the uncertainty of whether it is pleasant or unpleasant.

original: des na yang sdug pa dang mi sdug pa gnyis mthong ba dang ma mthong ba sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: des na yang sdug pa dang mi sdug pa gnyis mthong ba dang ma mthong ba sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa mnyam pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, seeing and not seeing the pleasant and the unpleasant are equal with regard to being causes of suffering.

original: 'di bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di bya ba ma yin no //
translated: This is not to be done.

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba las sdug bsngal zhes bya ba de gang las she na /
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba las sdug bsngal zhes bya ba de gang las she na /
translated: From what does suffering arise that is called ‚Äúfrom seeing and not seeing the pleasant and the unpleasant‚Äù?

original: sdug pa dang ni zhes bya smos te /
analyzed: sdug pa dang ni zhes bya smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúFrom the pleasant and the unpleasant.‚Äù

original: sdug pa ni pha dang ma dang bu dang chung ma la sogs pa dang rjes su chags pa'i yul dang / bye zhing bral ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdug pa ni pha dang ma dang bu dang chung ma la sogs pa dang rjes su chags pa'i yul dang / bye zhing bral ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The pleasant refers to one‚Äôs mother, father, children, spouse, and so on, and the objects of one‚Äôs attachment.

original: bral bar snang ba na mya ngan mi bzad skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bral bar snang ba na mya ngan mi bzad skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom being separated from what is pleasant‚Äù should be connected with the phrase ‚Äúunbearable grief arises.‚Äù

original: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa yis zhes bya ba la mi sdug pa yang dgra bo la sogs pa yang phrad pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa yis zhes bya ba la mi sdug pa yang dgra bo la sogs pa yang phrad pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom encountering the unpleasant‚Äù means encountering one‚Äôs enemies and so on.

original: mya ngan mi bzad skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan mi bzad skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Unbearable grief arises.

original: zhes bya ba ni gdung ba chen po skye ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gdung ba chen po skye ba yin no //
translated: This means that great anguish arises.

original: gdung ba @143b che nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gdung ba @143b che nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the great sorrow, he says:

original: gang gis mi dag rgas byed pa'i //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gis mi dag rgas byed pa'i // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: By which people grow old.

original: gang mya ngan skyes pa ni 'dam bu brngas pa nyi mas gdungs pa bzhin du 'dod chags can 'joms par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang mya ngan skyes pa ni 'dam bu brngas pa nyi mas gdungs pa bzhin du 'dod chags can 'joms par 'gyur te /
translated: By which people grow old means that sorrow arises, like a field of reeds struck by the sun, and destroys the passionate.

original: bram ze ba la bya zhes bya ba'i bu mo dang slob ma gnyis yun ring por bltas pas rjes su chags pa rgya cher gyur to //
analyzed: bram ze ba la bya zhes bya ba'i bu mo dang slob ma gnyis yun ring por bltas pas rjes su chags pa rgya cher gyur to //
translated: The story of the daughter of the brahmin Balbaja and her student should be told here. They looked at each other for a long time, and their attachment grew.

original: dus cung zad cig bral ba las shin du phrad par 'dod de /
analyzed: dus cung zad cig bral ba las shin du phrad par 'dod de /
translated: After being separated for a short time, they desired to meet very much.

original: phrad par gyur pa la phan tshun gcig la gcig shas cher chags shing 'khyud ba tsam gyis shi zhing lus skams par gyur to //
analyzed: phrad par gyur pa la phan tshun gcig la gcig shas cher chags shing 'khyud ba tsam gyis shi zhing lus skams par gyur to //
translated: When they met, they embraced each other with great passion, and died, their bodies dried up.

original: tsandan gi ri ka zhes bya ba la bltas pa tsam nyid kyis tsam pa'i pha shi ba yang 'dir dper brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tsandan gi ri ka zhes bya ba la bltas pa tsam nyid kyis tsam pa'i pha shi ba yang 'dir dper brjod par bya'o //
translated: The story of Candanagirika should also be told here. By merely looking at him, the father of the Campaka woman died.

original: gson pa la mi sdug pa nyid de dang 'brel ba'i mya ngan la sogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: gson pa la mi sdug pa nyid de dang 'brel ba'i mya ngan la sogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the unpleasantness of life and the sorrow, etc. associated with it,

original: 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i bstan par bya ste /
translated: The teaching on death is to be stated:

original: sdug ba shi bar gyur pa na //
analyzed: sdug ba shi bar gyur pa na //
translated: When a loved one dies,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says.

original: nye du dang rtsa lag dang grogs bshes la sogs pa ni sdug pa'o //
analyzed: nye du dang rtsa lag dang grogs bshes la sogs pa ni sdug pa'o //
translated: Loved ones are relatives, friends, companions, and so on.

original: shi bar gyur pa ni dus las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: shi bar gyur pa ni dus las 'das pa ste /
translated: When they die, they pass away.

original: srog dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: srog dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
translated: They lose their life.

original: na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sdug pa dang bral na nye du la sogs pa sdug bsngal zhing yun ring du mya ngan byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sdug pa dang bral na nye du la sogs pa sdug bsngal zhing yun ring du mya ngan byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the suffering of separation from loved ones, relatives and so on grieve for a long time, he says.

original: 'tsho ba'i tshe gcig pur ma zad de /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i tshe gcig pur ma zad de /
translated: Not only while alive,

original: sdug bsngal mi bzad pas gdungs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi bzad pas gdungs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: but also when dead, they are tormented by unbearable suffering.

original: de bas na sdug pa'i skye bo yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na sdug pa'i skye bo yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, one should abandon loved ones, he teaches.

original: sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa ni lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa'i //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa ni lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa'i //
translated: Those who are tormented by suffering are harmed by the suffering of body and mind.

original: gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na /
translated: Who are they?

original: gnyen 'dun zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyen 'dun zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says relatives.

original: pha dang ma dang gnyen du 'brel pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pha dang ma dang gnyen du 'brel pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Father, mother, relatives, and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyis gnyen du 'brel par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnyen du 'brel par ston pa yin no //
translated: It is the natural relationship of friends that is being taught.

original: bcos ma ni mdza' bshes zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: bcos ma ni mdza' bshes zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: The artificial is indicated by the words ‚Äúfriendships‚Äù and so on.

original: mdza' bshes dag la shin tu brtse ba'i snying yod pa de ni mdza' bshes so //
analyzed: mdza' bshes dag la shin tu brtse ba'i snying yod pa de ni mdza' bshes so //
translated: A friend is one who has a heart that is very affectionate toward friends.

original: ji ltar mya ngan byed cing gdung bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mya ngan byed cing gdung bar byed ce na /
translated: How does one grieve and lament?

original: smras pa / mang po ste lhag ma'i rnam pa du ma'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mang po ste lhag ma'i rnam pa du ma'o //
translated: It is said: ‚Äúmany times,‚Äù in many different ways.

original: dus ji tsam zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / yun ring dus su zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dus ji tsam zhe na / smras pa / yun ring dus su zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: For how long a time?üîΩIt is said: ‚Äúfor a long time,‚Äù

original: dus ring po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus ring po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: for a long period of time.

original: des na de'i phyir /üîΩsdug dang bral bas sdug bsngal 'gyur //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir / sdug dang bral bas sdug bsngal 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne suffers from separation from the dear ones.‚Äù

original: gdung bar byed pa ni skye bo sdug pa dang bral ba sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir shin tu mi bzad pa'i dug bzhin no //üîΩgang gi phyir ji skad du gsungs pa ste /üîΩde'i phyir / sdug par byed pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: gdung bar byed pa ni skye bo sdug pa dang bral ba sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir shin tu mi bzad pa'i dug bzhin no // gang gi phyir ji skad du gsungs pa ste / de'i phyir / sdug par byed pa mi bya'o //
translated: One who is tormented by the cause of suffering, separation from dear ones, is like a person who has been poisoned.üîΩBecause of this, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not make dear ones.‚Äù

original: chags pa'i dngos po @144a * //
analyzed: chags pa'i dngos po @144a * //
translated: The object of attachmentüîΩ

original: ni cung zad kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: ni cung zad kyang mi bya'o //
translated: One should not do anything that is an object of attachment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sdug nyid sdig can la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdug nyid sdig can la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúFor the one who is attached, even what is beautiful is sinful.‚Äù

original: gang la sdug pa bstan pa yod pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dga' ba zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gang la sdug pa bstan pa yod pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dga' ba zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The one who is attached to what is beautiful is one who has the pleasure of the afflictions.

original: de yang dpag tu med pa'i sdig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sdig pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang dpag tu med pa'i sdig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sdig pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is also called ‚Äúsinful‚Äù because it is the cause of immeasurable sin.

original: 'di ltar gang las ngan par spyod pa thams cad kyi gzhi ni 'di las byung ba yin pas de bas na byed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang las ngan par spyod pa thams cad kyi gzhi ni 'di las byung ba yin pas de bas na byed par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, since the basis of all bad conduct arises from that, therefore one should not do it.

original: yang na sdug pa nyid ces bya ba ni sdug pa'i dngos po sems dang bcas pa dang sems med pa'i dngos po la chags pa ste /
analyzed: yang na sdug pa nyid ces bya ba ni sdug pa'i dngos po sems dang bcas pa dang sems med pa'i dngos po la chags pa ste /
translated: Or else, ‚Äúwhat is beautiful‚Äù is attachment to an object of attachment, whether it is a sentient or an insentient object.

original: spyir rab tu gzung ngo //
analyzed: spyir rab tu gzung ngo //
translated: It is generally grasped.

original: mi sdug pa la yang 'di las bzlog par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la yang 'di las bzlog par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that should be stated with regard to what is not beautiful.

original: mi sdug pa dag ma shi bar gyur na gnyen 'dun dang mdza' bshes mang po dus yun ring du mya ngan byed de /
analyzed: mi sdug pa dag ma shi bar gyur na gnyen 'dun dang mdza' bshes mang po dus yun ring du mya ngan byed de /
translated: When the unpleasant do not die, many relatives and friends grieve for a long time.

original: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal gyis so //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal gyis so //
translated: Because of the suffering of contact with the unpleasant.
